title: Sambar (Classic, with vegetables)
ingredients: 1.5 cups mixed vegetables (carrot, drumstick, beans, etc.)
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft and mash it.
Boil chopped vegetables with salt and water until tender.
Add tamarind paste and sambar powder to the vegetables and simmer.
Add the mashed dal and mix well. Let it simmer for 5–10 minutes.
Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, add red chilies, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Pour the tempering over the sambar and mix well.
Serve hot with rice or idli/dosa.

title: Tomato Pappu (Andhra)
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and chopped tomatoes until soft.
Mash the dal mixture and keep aside.
Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Add garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, and asafoetida. Sauté for a minute.
Add the mashed dal, salt, and some water to adjust consistency.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot with rice.

title: Gongura Pappu (Roselle Leaves Dal)
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft.
Cook gongura leaves with green chilies until wilted.
Mash dal and mix with cooked gongura.
Heat oil, splutter mustard and cumin seeds, add garlic, dry red chilies, and curry leaves.
Add the tempering to the dal, simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve with hot rice and ghee.

title: Palak Pappu (Spinach Dal)
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft.
Add chopped spinach and green chilies to the dal and cook for 5 minutes.
Heat oil, splutter mustard and cumin seeds, add garlic and curry leaves.
Add the tempering to the dal and mix well.
Serve hot with rice and ghee.

title: Toor Dal Rasam
instructions: Cook and mash toor dal.
In a pan, add tomato, tamarind pulp, rasam powder, turmeric, and water. Boil until raw smell goes.
Add mashed dal and adjust consistency. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Heat ghee, splutter mustard, cumin, garlic, red chilies, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Add tempering to rasam. Serve hot with rice.

title: Lemon Rasam
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and mash it.
Boil water with green chili and salt for 2-3 minutes.
Add mashed dal and simmer briefly. Turn off the heat.
Add lemon juice and mix well.
Heat ghee, splutter mustard, cumin, red chili, curry leaves, and asafoetida.
Add tempering to rasam. Serve hot with rice.

title: Mysore Rasam
instructions: Cook toor dal and mash it.
Grind coconut, pepper, and coriander to a paste.
In a pot, cook tomato, turmeric, rasam powder, salt, and ground paste with water.
Add mashed dal and simmer.
Heat oil, splutter mustard, cumin, red chilies, and curry leaves.
Add tempering to rasam. Serve with rice.

title: Garlic Rasam
instructions: Cook and mash toor dal.
Crush garlic and set aside.
Boil tamarind, tomato, rasam powder, turmeric, and salt with water.
Add mashed dal and simmer.
Heat ghee, splutter mustard, cumin, add garlic, curry leaves, and red chilies.
Pour tempering over rasam. Serve hot.

title: Moong Dal Coconut Curry
instructions: Cook moong dal until soft.
Grind coconut and green chilies to a paste.
Add the paste to the cooked dal with turmeric and simmer.
Heat oil, splutter mustard, cumin, and add curry leaves.
Add tempering to curry and mix well.
Serve with rice or chapati.

title: Drumstick Dal
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft.
Boil drumsticks with tomato and green chilies until tender.
Mix boiled vegetables with mashed dal and simmer.
Heat oil, splutter mustard and cumin, add garlic and curry leaves.
Add tempering to dal and mix well.
Serve with hot rice.

title: Horse Gram Dal (Kollu Paruppu)
instructions: Wash and soak horse gram for 6 hours or overnight.
Pressure cook with turmeric and water until soft.
Heat oil, add cumin, red chili, garlic, and onions, and sauté.
Add cooked horse gram and salt, simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Mash slightly and serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Mango Dal (Mamidi Kaya Pappu)
instructions: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric until soft.
In a pot, cook raw mango pieces with green chili and little water.
Add the cooked dal and salt, and simmer until combined.
Prepare tempering with mustard, cumin, garlic, and curry leaves.
Add tempering to the dal and mix well. Serve hot.

title: Aloo Tomato Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, and cook till soft.
Add cubed potatoes, salt, and water. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.
Serve hot with chapati or rice.

title: Aloo Beans Curry
instructions: Heat oil and add mustard seeds.
Add onions and sauté until golden.
Add beans and potatoes, stir well.
Add turmeric, chili powder, salt, and little water.
Cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Potato Roast (Urulai Varuval)
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves.
Add potatoes, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Roast on medium flame until golden and crispy.
Serve hot as a side dish.

title: Potato Kurma (with coconut)
instructions: Grind coconut, green chilies, fennel to a smooth paste.
Heat oil, sauté onion, ginger-garlic paste, then add tomato.
Add turmeric, salt, and coconut paste.
Add potatoes and little water. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with chapati or dosa.

title: Brinjal Curry (Vankaya Kura)
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add onion, sauté till translucent. Add tomatoes and cook soft.
Add brinjal, turmeric, chili powder, salt and little water.
Cover and cook till brinjal is tender.
Serve with rice or chapati.

title: Gutti Vankaya (Stuffed Eggplant Andhra)
instructions: Dry roast peanuts, sesame, coconut and grind to powder.
Mix with chili powder, coriander powder, salt.
Slit brinjals and stuff with the mixture.
Heat oil, sauté onions, add stuffed brinjals.
Cook covered until tender, turning occasionally.
Serve with rice.

title: Brinjal Kara Kuzhambu
instructions: Sauté mustard seeds, curry leaves, onion, and tomato in oil.
Add chopped brinjal, turmeric, sambar powder.
Pour tamarind extract and salt, simmer until brinjals soften.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

title: Bhindi Curry (Bendakaya Pulusu)
instructions: Sauté mustard seeds and onion in oil.
Add chopped bhindi and sauté until no slime remains.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, chili powder, and cook for a few mins.
Pour tamarind extract, add salt, simmer until cooked.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Beans Poriyal
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Once they splutter, add urad dal, red chilies, asafoetida, and curry leaves.
Add the chopped beans and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add a little water, cover, and cook till beans are tender.
Add salt and grated coconut, mix well and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve hot with rice and sambar.

title: Cabbage Thoran
instructions: Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin to a coarse paste.
Heat oil in a pan and splutter mustard seeds.
Add curry leaves and chopped cabbage.
Add the ground coconut mixture and mix well.
Cover and cook on low flame till cabbage is tender.
Serve hot as a side dish with rice.

title: Cabbage Kootu
instructions: Cook moong dal with turmeric until soft.
Add chopped cabbage and cook until tender.
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin seeds into a paste.
Add the paste and salt to the dal-cabbage mixture and simmer for 5 minutes.
In a small pan, heat oil and splutter mustard seeds with curry leaves.
Add the tempering to the kootu and mix well.
Serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Carrot Beans Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and splutter mustard seeds.
Add urad dal, red chili, and curry leaves.
Add carrots and beans and sauté for 2 minutes.
Sprinkle some water, cover and cook until vegetables are tender.
Add salt and grated coconut, mix well.
Serve as a side dish with rice.

title: Capsicum Stir-Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Once they splutter, add urad dal, green chili, and sliced onion.
Sauté till onions are soft, then add capsicum and stir-fry.
Cook for 5-7 minutes until capsicum is tender yet crunchy.
Add salt and grated coconut, mix well.
Serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Beetroot Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Add urad dal, green chilies, and turmeric.
Add grated beetroot and mix well.
Cover and cook on low flame till beetroot is soft.
Add salt and coconut, mix and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve warm with rice or roti.

title: Drumstick Curry (Murungakkai Kara Kuzhambu)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft.
Add turmeric, sambar powder, and tamarind paste.
Add drumstick pieces and enough water to cook.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes until drumsticks are tender.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Ridge Gourd Curry (Peerkangai Kootu)
ingredients: 2 cups peeled and chopped ridge gourd
instructions: Cook moong dal with turmeric until soft.
Add ridge gourd pieces and cook until tender.
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin into a paste.
Add the paste to the dal mixture with salt and simmer.
Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil and pour over the curry.
Serve with rice or chapati.

title: Bottle Gourd Curry (Sorakkai Kootu)
instructions: Cook moong dal with turmeric until soft.
Add bottle gourd pieces and cook until tender.
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin to a paste.
Add paste and salt to the cooked dal and simmer.
Heat oil and splutter mustard seeds with curry leaves.
Add tempering to the kootu and mix well.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Snake Gourd Curry (Podalangai Poriyal)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add urad dal, green chilies, and curry leaves.
Add snake gourd and sauté for 2 minutes.
Cover and cook until tender.
Add salt and grated coconut, mix well and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve with rice and sambar.

title: Raw Banana Curry
instructions: Peel and chop raw bananas into cubes, boil with salt and turmeric till tender.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard and cumin seeds.
Add curry leaves and cooked banana.
Add red chili powder and sambar powder.
Stir well and cook for 5 mins until flavors combine.
Serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Banana Stem Curry
instructions: Chop banana stem and soak in buttermilk water to prevent darkening.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and urad dal.
Add green chili and turmeric.
Add banana stem and salt. Cook covered until soft.
Add grated coconut and mix well.
Serve with rice.

title: Ash Gourd Curry
instructions: Boil ash gourd with turmeric and salt till tender.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin, and curry leaves.
Add cooked ash gourd and chili powder.
Add coconut milk and simmer for 5 mins.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Yam Curry (Suran Masala)
instructions: Boil yam cubes until soft and set aside.
Heat oil, sauté onions till golden.
Add ginger garlic paste, tomatoes, and spices.
Cook till oil separates, add yam and mix.
Cook covered for 10 mins and garnish.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Cluster Beans Curry (Goruchikkudu Kura)
instructions: Boil cluster beans until tender.
Heat oil and add mustard and cumin seeds.
Add onions and sauté till soft.
Add turmeric and chili powder.
Add cluster beans and salt, sauté for 5-6 mins.
Serve with chapati or rice.

title: Broad Beans Curry (Avarakkai Poriyal)
instructions: Boil broad beans with salt and turmeric until tender.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, red chili, and curry leaves.
Add boiled broad beans and sauté for 5 minutes.
Add grated coconut and stir well.
Serve with steamed rice or sambar.

title: Turnip Curry
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until translucent.
Add tomatoes and cook till soft.
Add spices and mix well.
Add turnips and salt, cook covered until tender.
Garnish with coriander and serve.

title: Pumpkin Erissery
instructions: Cook pumpkin with turmeric and salt until soft.
Grind coconut, cumin, and one red chili into a coarse paste.
Add the paste to the pumpkin and simmer.
Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, add red chili and curry leaves.
Pour tempering over the curry and mix.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Mixed Vegetable Kurma
instructions: Boil all vegetables till soft.
Heat oil, sauté onions, add ginger garlic paste and tomatoes.
Add spices and coconut paste, cook till fragrant.
Add boiled vegetables and salt, simmer for 10 mins.
Serve with chapati or pulao.

title: Avial
instructions: Cook all vegetables with turmeric and salt until soft.
Grind coconut, green chilies, and cumin into a paste.
Add the paste and yogurt to cooked vegetables and simmer gently.
Add coconut oil and curry leaves as finishing touch.
Serve with rice.

title: Kootu Curry (Kerala)
instructions: Cook raw banana with turmeric and salt until soft.
Grind coconut, cumin, and one red chili into a coarse paste.
Add cooked chickpeas and coconut paste to banana, simmer gently.
Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, add red chili and curry leaves.
Pour tempering over the curry and mix well.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Kerala Theeyal
instructions: Roast coconut, coriander seeds, and fenugreek until dark brown and grind to a paste.
Soak tamarind in water and extract juice.
Sauté onions in oil until golden.
Add turmeric, chili powder, and ground paste, sauté well.
Add tamarind juice and salt, cook until oil separates.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Serve with rice.

title: Vendakka Pachadi (Okra Yogurt Curry)
instructions: Fry chopped okra until crispy and keep aside.
Grind coconut, green chilies, and mustard seeds to a paste.
Mix ground paste with yogurt and add salt.
Add fried okra to the mixture and stir gently.
Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in coconut oil.
Pour tempering over the pachadi and serve chilled.

title: Inji Puli (Ginger Tamarind Curry)
instructions: Soak tamarind in warm water and extract juice.
Fry ginger and green chilies in oil until browned.
Add turmeric, tamarind extract, salt, and jaggery.
Boil until thickened and oil begins to separate.
Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil.
Mix into the curry and store in a jar.
Serve as a condiment with rice.

title: Mango Pachadi (Tamil Nadu)
instructions: Boil mango pieces with turmeric and salt until soft.
Add jaggery and cook until it dissolves completely.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, red chili, and curry leaves for tempering.
Add tempering to mango-jaggery mix and stir well.
Serve as a sweet-tangy side dish with rice.

title: Kovakkai Curry (Ivy Gourd)
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, urad dal, and curry leaves.
Add chopped onions and sauté till translucent.
Add ivy gourd, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Cook covered on low flame until tender and slightly crispy.
Serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Paneer Kurma (Coconut-Based)
instructions: Grind coconut, green chilies, and fennel seeds into a smooth paste.
Heat oil, sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste until golden.
Add turmeric, garam masala, and coconut paste, cook well.
Add paneer cubes and little water, simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Add curry leaves, adjust salt, and serve hot with paratha or rice.

title: Chettinad Paneer Masala
instructions: Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Add onion and sauté till golden, add ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, and Chettinad masala, cook till oil separates.
Add paneer cubes and a little water, simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with dosa or rice.

title: Paneer Tomato Curry
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until soft.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, and chili powder.
Add tomato puree, cook till oil separates.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and serve with roti or rice.

title: Spicy Paneer Roast
instructions: Marinate paneer with chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Heat oil in a pan, add ginger-garlic paste and sauté briefly.
Add marinated paneer and roast on medium flame until golden and crisp.
Serve hot as a starter or side dish.

title: Pepper Paneer Curry
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds, and sauté onions.
Add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, garam masala, and pepper.
Add paneer cubes and salt, sauté until coated and heated through.
Serve with chapati or pulao.

title: Paneer Stew (Kerala Style)
instructions: Heat coconut oil, sauté ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and peppercorns.
Add onions, curry leaves, and green chilies, sauté till soft.
Add paneer and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer gently without boiling.
Serve warm with appam or idiyappam.

title: Paneer Sambar
instructions: Cook toor dal until soft and mash well.
In a pan, sauté onions, tomatoes, turmeric, and sambar powder.
Add cooked dal, paneer cubes, and water to desired consistency.
Boil for 5 minutes and adjust salt.
Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves, add to sambar.
Serve hot with rice or idli.

title: Muttai Paneer Kuzhambu (Egg-Paneer Curry Combo)
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions, tomatoes, and ginger-garlic paste.
Add turmeric, curry powder, salt and mix well.
Add paneer cubes and water, simmer for 5 mins.
Add halved boiled eggs and cook for 2–3 mins.
Garnish and serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Paneer with Gongura
instructions: Cook gongura leaves with chilies until soft and mash well.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds and onions, sauté.
Add turmeric and paneer, sauté lightly.
Mix in mashed gongura and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice.

title: Paneer and Drumstick Curry
instructions: Boil drumstick pieces until tender.
Sauté onions and tomatoes with turmeric and sambar powder.
Add drumsticks and paneer, cook with a little water.
Simmer for 10 minutes, add salt and curry leaves.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Mushroom Pepper Fry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin, fennel seeds, and curry leaves.
Add sliced onions and green chilies, sauté until translucent.
Add ginger garlic paste and cook till raw smell disappears.
Add mushrooms and sauté on high flame for 5-7 minutes.
Add crushed pepper and salt, mix well and cook until dry.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Mushroom Kurma
instructions: Grind coconut, cashews, and poppy seeds to a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions and ginger garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mushrooms, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt.
Add the ground paste and water. Cook covered until mushrooms are soft.
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with coriander leaves.

title: Mushroom Coconut Masala
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Sauté onions until golden. Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mushrooms, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add garam masala, stir, and serve hot.

title: Mushroom and Peas Curry
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger garlic paste and cook till raw smell disappears.
Add tomatoes and cook till mushy.
Add turmeric, coriander powder, salt and cook for 2 minutes.
Add mushrooms and green peas, mix well and cook for 10-12 minutes.
Add garam masala, stir and serve.

title: Mushroom Tomato Curry
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Sauté onions and ginger garlic paste until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mushrooms, turmeric, chili powder, and salt.
Cook until mushrooms are tender and gravy thickens.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve.

title: Spicy Mushroom Roast
instructions: Heat oil, add curry leaves, onions and green chilies.
Sauté until golden brown.
Add mushrooms, salt, red chili powder and cook on medium flame.
Add pepper and garam masala, sauté until dry.
Serve hot as a side dish or with chapati.

title: Chettinad Mushroom Curry
instructions: Heat oil and add mustard seeds, curry leaves.
Sauté onions and ginger garlic paste.
Add tomatoes, turmeric, Chettinad masala and cook well.
Add mushrooms, salt, and cook till mushrooms soften.
Simmer until thick and flavorful.

title: Mushroom Kurma with Cashew-Coconut Base
instructions: Grind coconut, cashews, and poppy seeds to a fine paste.
Heat oil and sauté onions and ginger garlic paste.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add mushrooms, salt, and ground paste with water.
Cook covered until mushrooms are soft. Sprinkle garam masala and mix.

title: Mushroom Brinjal Curry
instructions: Heat oil, sauté onions and curry leaves.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add brinjal, salt, turmeric and chili powder, cook for 5 mins.
Add mushrooms and cook until both are tender.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Gongura Mushroom Curry
instructions: Heat oil, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
Sauté onions, add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add gongura leaves and cook until wilted.
Add mushrooms, salt, turmeric and chili powder.
Cook until mushrooms are tender and curry thickens.

title: Mor Kuzhambu (Buttermilk Curry)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder and cooked moong dal.
Add the buttermilk and rice flour mixture to the pan and stir well.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add salt to taste and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Rasavangi (Brinjal Coconut Curry)
instructions: Grind the coconut, roasted gram dal, and red chilies into a smooth paste.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder and chopped brinjals.
Sauté for 5-6 minutes until the brinjals soften.
Add the ground coconut paste and a little water, cook for 10 minutes.
Add salt and simmer for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot with rice or roti.

title: Kalan Curry (Kerala Yogurt & Yam)
instructions: Cook the yam cubes in water until soft.
In a blender, make a smooth paste of grated coconut, cumin seeds, and turmeric powder.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add ginger paste and dried red chilies.
Add the yam and coconut paste, stir well.
Add yogurt, black pepper, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes on low flame.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Kootu with Chow Chow (Chayote)
ingredients: 2 medium chayote (chow chow), peeled and chopped
instructions: Cook the moong dal in a pressure cooker until soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add chopped chayote and turmeric powder.
Sauté for 5-7 minutes, add cooked moong dal and water.
Simmer for 10-12 minutes until the chayote is cooked.
Grind the coconut and black pepper into a smooth paste and add to the curry.
Cook for another 5 minutes and adjust salt.
Serve with rice.

title: Senai Kizhangu Masiyal (Yam Mash Curry)
instructions: Boil the yam until soft and mash it.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chili, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder and the mashed yam.
Add black pepper, salt, and stir well.
Grind the coconut into a smooth paste and add it to the mashed yam.
Cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Kathirikai Pitlai (Brinjal & Dal Curry)
instructions: Cook the toor dal in a pressure cooker until soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add chopped brinjals and sauté for 5-7 minutes.
Add the cooked dal, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and some water.
Simmer for 10-12 minutes, then add the grated coconut and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with steamed rice.

title: Thakkali Thokku (Tomato Curry)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder.
Add chopped tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes until they soften.
Add tamarind extract and salt, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Cook until the curry thickens and oil starts separating.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Capsicum Potato Masala
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala.
Add chopped capsicums and sauté for 5 minutes.
Add boiled potatoes and salt, mix well, and cook for another 7-8 minutes.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

title: Cauliflower Kurma
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and coriander powder.
Add chopped cauliflower and sauté for 5 minutes.
Add coconut milk, grated coconut, and salt. Cook covered for 10-12 minutes.
Serve with roti or rice.

title: Keerai Masiyal (Spinach Mash Curry)
instructions: Cook the toor dal in a pressure cooker until soft.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder, black pepper, and red chili powder.
Add the chopped spinach and cook for 5-7 minutes until wilted.
Add the cooked dal, mix well, and mash the curry.
Cook for another 5 minutes and adjust salt.
Serve with rice.

title: Puli Kuzhambu (Tamarind Curry)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and fenugreek seeds.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add tamarind pulp and water, and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes until it thickens.
Add curry leaves and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Vendakkai Puli Kuzhambu (Okra Tamarind Curry)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add chopped okra and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Add tamarind pulp and water, and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Onion Tomato Gravy
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Once the gravy thickens and the oil separates, remove from heat.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Jeera Aloo South Style
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add turmeric powder and red chili powder.
Add boiled potatoes and sauté for 5-7 minutes, allowing them to crisp up.
Add salt and mix well. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with rice or roti.

title: Paneer-Mushroom Mix Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add cubed paneer and salt. Cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve with roti or rice.

title: Raw Mango Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add chopped raw mango and water, and cook for 10-12 minutes until the mango softens.
Serve with rice.

title: Curd Curry with Raw Mango
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add chopped raw mango and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add curd and mix well. Let it simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Curry Leaves Masala Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add curry leaves and cook for another 5-7 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Thavala Kuzhambu (Mixed Lentil Curry)
instructions: Cook the lentils in a pressure cooker with enough water for 3-4 whistles.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add the cooked lentils, mix well, and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.

title: Tiffin Sambar (Thick, no vegetables)
instructions: Cook the toor dal in a pressure cooker for 3-4 whistles.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add tamarind pulp, turmeric powder, red chili powder, sambar powder, and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Add the cooked dal and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with idli or dosa.

title: Kuzhi Curry (Kerala mixed lentil curry)
instructions: Cook the lentils in a pressure cooker with enough water for 3-4 whistles.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.
Once they splutter, add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
Add the cooked lentils, mix well, and let it simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve with rice.
